p: Noting the essential role of arginine for immunity, an arginine deficiency syndrome (ADS) was proposed, defined by pathological increase in arginase, decreased NO production, decreased arginine availability, abnormal T cell function including loss of Î¶-chain, and presence of one or more of: trauma, cancer, chronic infection, liver necrosis, pulmonary hypertension; treatment for ADS include L-arginine and the arginase inhibitors N-hydroxy-arginine (NOHA) and COX-2 inhibitors.
